15. The Beneclietion.

GERMAIN 1: Benedictionem vero populi sacerdotibus fundere Dominus per Moysen mandavit. . . . Propter servandum honorem pontificis sacri constituerunt canones ut lonyiorem benedictionem episcopus proferret, breviorem presbyter funderet, dicens2: “ Pax, fides et caritas et communicatio corporis et sanguinis Domini sit semper vobiscum.'’

The Benediction was the occasion of the introduction of a great number of formularies, varying with the festivals of the year, formularies which survived in France even after the adoption of the Roman Liturgy.
